question: The pilot project launched in January 2025 for controlled cannabis cultivation was launched by which state government?
solution:
• Thepilot project for controlled cannabis cultivationwas launched by theHimachal Pradesh governmentin January 2025.
  • Himachal Pradeshhas recently launched other notable schemes:
    • Indira Gandhi Pyari Behna Sukh-Samman Nidhi Yojanafor women's welfare.
    • HIMCARE scheme: Provides cashless medical treatment up to ₹5 lakh per family per year in empaneled hospitals for eligible families.
    • Swach Shehar, Smridh Shehar campaignlaunched in February 2025 to promote urban cleanliness and sustainable development.
    • Pangi declared as first natural farming sub-division in July 2025.
  • The state is promotingrural economy, natural farming, digital service delivery, and climate-smart initiativesfor inclusive growth and environmental sustainability.

question: PARTH Yojana launched in January 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• PARTH Yojana was launched by theMadhya Pradesh governmentin January 2025.
  • PARTH stands for Police Army Recruitment Training & Hunar.
  • The scheme aims to providepre-recruitment trainingto youth aspiring to join police, army, and paramilitary forces.
  • Focuses on buildingdiscipline, confidence, and skillsamong the youth.
  • Madhya Pradesh has also launched other youth-centric schemes like theMukhyamantri Seekho Kamao Yojanafor skill development and employment.

question: Shaheed Madho Singh Haath Kharcha, launched in January 2025, was started by which state government?
solution:
• Shaheed Madho Singh Haath Kharcha was launched by theOdisha governmentin January 2025.
  • The scheme provides a₹5,000 one-time direct benefit transfer to Scheduled Tribe (ST) students enrolling in Class IX & XIto prevent dropouts.
  • Eligibility:Students must belong to ST community, enrolled in government or government-aided schools, with annual family income less than ₹2.5 lakh.
  • Named in honor ofMadho Singh Bariha, a freedom fighter from Bargarh who resisted British rule during the 1857 uprising.
  • Budget:About ₹156 crore allocated, to benefit approximately 2–3 lakh tribal students across Odisha.
  • Applications are processed via the Odisha State Scholarship Portal and overseen by the ST & SC Development Department.
  • Other current Odisha updates:“Mo Ghara” housing scheme for rural poor, “Odisha Millet Mission” for nutrition, new AI learning labs in schools, and boost to tribal entrepreneurship.

question: Deendayal Upadhyay Bhoomiheen Krishi Majdoor Kalyan Yojana launched in January 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• Deendayal Upadhyay Bhoomiheen Krishi Majdoor Kalyan Yojana was launched by theChhattisgarh governmentin January 2025.
  • The scheme provides₹10,000 annual financial aid to landless agricultural labourersto improve their livelihood and ensure economic stability.
  • It aims to support the most vulnerable agricultural workers who do not own land, helping reduce poverty and dependence on informal loans.
  • The aid is provided through direct benefit transfer to eligible beneficiaries.
  • Chhattisgarh has also implemented other welfare schemes like theRajiv Gandhi Kisan Nyay Yojanafor farmers andGodhan Nyay Yojanapromoting livestock and rural economy.

question: Nodi Bandhan scheme launched in February 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheNodi Bandhan schemewas launched by theWest Bengal governmentin February 2025.
  • The scheme aims to promoteriverine developmentandcurb erosion along the Ganga-Padmabyinterlinking rivers and wetlands.
  • It boosts livelihoods through improvedirrigation, pisciculture (fish farming), and eco-friendly infrastructure.
  • The state allocated an initial₹200 croreto combat river erosion, especially in districts likeMurshidabad and Malda.
  • A significant part of the scheme is theGhatal Masterplan, focusing onflood prevention in West Midnaporewith a total projected cost of ₹1,500 crore.
  • The initiative usesnature-based solutions and hydrological modelsto create resilient infrastructure and sustainable development.
  • Expected to create employment opportunities inagriculture, fisheries, and small-scale industries, enhancing the economy of river-dependent communities.

question: Skill Uday Tongai scheme launched in February 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheSkill Uday Tongai schemewas launched by theTripura governmentin February 2025.
  • It aims toempower 80,000 school and college studentswithindustry-relevant skills.
  • The scheme focuses onimproving employability, entrepreneurship, and inclusive growthacross Tripura.
  • Training programs are designed in collaboration with industries to ensure practical skill development and job readiness.
  • Tripura is actively focusing on youth skill development as part of its broader economic and social growth strategies.

question: Which scheme launched by Rajasthan government in February 2025 provides accident insurance and scholarships to students who lost parents in accidents?
option_1: Shiksha Sanjeevani Bima Yojana
option_2: Mukhyamantri Balak Suraksha Yojana
solution:
• Shiksha Sanjeevani Bima Yojanawas launched by theRajasthan government in February 2025.
  • It provides₹1 lakh accident insuranceandscholarships till age 18for students who lost parents in accidents.
  • Covers about3 lakh students initially in Udaipur division, expanding to benefit nearlyone crore studentsstatewide.
  • Partners includeWonder Cement, Zurich Kotak General Insurance, and SBI.
  • Aims to ensure education continuity, prevent child labor, and promote financial inclusion.

Other scheme details:

  • Mukhyamantri Balak Suraksha Yojanaprovides economic and educational support to orphaned children and youth up to 18 years to improve their livelihood and social integration.
  • Rajshri Prerna Yojanafocuses on scholarships and motivation for girls' education in Rajasthan.
  • Vidya Jyoti Yojanatargets improving school infrastructure and quality education in rural Rajasthan.

question: nPROUD scheme launched in February 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• ThenPROUD schemewas launched by theKerala governmentin February 2025.
  • It focuses on thesafe collection and disposal of expired medicinesto prevent environmental pollution and health risks.
  • The scheme raises awareness about proper disposal of pharmaceutical waste to protect public health.
  • Kerala is known for advancingenvironmental health initiativesand waste management programs.
  • Other recent Kerala initiatives include“Clean Kerala Mission”and promotion ofsustainable healthcare practices.

question: Bikashita Gaon Yojana launched in February 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheBikashita Gaon Yojanawas launched by theOdisha governmentin February 2025.
  • It is a₹5,000 crore rural infrastructure development schemeaimed at providingurban-like amenitiesand boosting the quality of life in rural areas.
  • The scheme focuses on improvingroad connectivity, civic amenities, educational facilities, and micro-tourismto ensure comprehensive rural development.
  • Implemented over five years, with annual plans developed through gram sabhas and gram panchayats ensuringlocal participation and transparency.
  • Odisha also continues to promote tribal welfare, rural entrepreneurship, and health & education initiatives alongside this scheme.

question: Which state government launched Project Hifazat in March 2025 to provide safety and swift support for women and children facing violence?
solution:
• Project Hifazat was launched by the Punjab government in March 2025.
  • The project aims to ensuresafety and swift support for women and children facing violence.
  • It includes24×7 helplines, rescue vehicles, and interdepartmental coordination.
  • Implemented under the frameworks ofMission Shakti and Mission Vatsalya.
  • Punjab is strengthening its efforts towardwomen’s safety and child protectionwith these integrated services.

question: CM Samriddhi Parivar Yojana launched in March 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• CM Samriddhi Parivar Yojanawas launched by theMadhya Pradesh governmentin March 2025.
  • The scheme providesa bundled package of welfare schemes for poor families, coveringemployment, education, health, and social security.
  • It aims for theholistic developmentof vulnerable families by tailoring benefits to their specific needs.
  • The scheme integrates multiple government programs for better outreach and impact.
  • Madhya Pradesh is focusing oninclusive growth and poverty alleviationthrough such multi-sectoral welfare initiatives.
  • Other youth and skill development schemes likePARTH YojanaandMukhyamantri Seekho Kamao Yojanaare part of Madhya Pradesh’s comprehensive welfare efforts.

question: Shishtachar Squad Scheme launched in March 2025 was started by which organization?
solution:
• TheShishtachar Squad Schemewas launched by theDelhi Policein March 2025.
  • The scheme aims tocurb eve-teasing and ensure women’s safety in public spaces.
  • Dedicated squads conductdaily patrols, surprise checks, and provide victim assistanceacross all districts.
  • Focuses on creating a safer environment for women through active policing and community engagement.
  • Delhi Police continues to strengthen its efforts towardswomen’s safety and public orderwith such innovative initiatives.

question: Mukhyamantri Balika Samridhi Yojana launched in March 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• Mukhyamantri Balika Samridhi Yojanawas launched by theTripura governmentin March 2025.
  • The scheme provides a₹50,000 bond at birthfor girls from BPL families.
  • The bond matures to₹8–10 lakh by the time the girl turns 18 years, ensuring financial security and empowerment.
  • The aim is to promotegirl child welfare, education, and empowermentthrough financial inclusion.
  • Tripura continues to focus on gender-sensitive social welfare schemes and inclusive growth.

question: How many female students are awarded free scooties under the Mukhyamantri Kanya Atmanirbhar Yojana launched in March 2025 by the Tripura government?
solution:
• Under theMukhyamantri Kanya Atmanirbhar Yojana, launched by theTripura governmentin March 2025,140 meritorious female studentsfrom higher secondary schools are awardedfree scooties.
  • The scheme aims to promotemobility, independence, and educational empowermentamong talented girls by providing them with safe and convenient transportation.
  • Of these,100 scooties are for TBSE passed students and 40 for CBSE passed students.
  • This initiative supports deserving girls in accessing higher education and encourages their overall development.

question: Rajiv Yuva Vikasam scheme launched in March 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheRajiv Yuva Vikasam schemewas launched by theTelangana governmentin March 2025.
  • The scheme provides₹3 lakh financial aidas concessional loans to5 lakh unemployed youthfrom SC, ST, BC, and Minority communities for starting self-employment ventures.
  • It aims to fosterentrepreneurship and economic empowermentamong marginalized youth.
  • Loans come with subsidies ranging from 60% to 80%, depending on the loan amount category.
  • The government allocated a budget of around₹6,000 crorefor smooth implementation.
  • This initiative supports youth to create jobs rather than just seeking them, boosting the state’s economy.

question: Odisha government started which scheme in March 2025 to provide housing assistance to rural families living in kutcha houses or without shelter?
option_1: Biju Pucca Ghar Yojana
option_3: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana
solution:
TheOdisha government launched the Antyodaya Gruha Yojana in March 2025to provide financial assistance of₹1.2 lakhfor building pucca houses to rural families living in kutcha houses or without any shelter.
  • The scheme aims to ensuredignified housingfor families who have been excluded from other housing schemes, including those affected by natural or man-made calamities, differently-abled primary earners, and Forest Rights Act beneficiaries.
  • It targets about50,000 beneficiaries initially, including widows, differently-abled persons, and families of martyrs or Padma awardees.
  • The assistance is released inthree installmentslinked to construction progress, with incentives for early completion.
  • The scheme is implemented through thePanchayati Raj & Drinking Water Departmentwith a budget provision of over ₹2,600 crore.
  • This initiative complements other Odisha housing efforts like Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) and Biju Pucca Ghar schemes.

question: Child Protection & State Action Plan launched in April 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheChild Protection & State Action Planwas launched by theKerala governmentin April 2025.
  • It aims toeliminate violence against children, especially sexual abuse, by enforcing relevant laws and promoting safe environments.
  • The scheme implements strategies aligned withWHO’s INSPIRE frameworkthrough the Women & Child Development Department.
  • Focus areas include child safety, protection from abuse, and creating awareness to ensure a supportive environment for children’s growth.
  • Kerala is recognized for its strong child welfare infrastructure, and this plan strengthens efforts toward comprehensive child protection.

question: jyothi scheme launched in may 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• Thejyothi schemewas launched by theKerala governmentinMay 2025.
  • It aims toenroll children of migrant workersintoanganwadis (ages 3-6)andpublic schools (ages 6 and above), ensuring inclusive education access.
  • The scheme promoteshealth support, social integration, and educational continuitydespite seasonal migration.
  • Implementation involves local self-governments, Kudumbashree workers, schoolteachers, and parent-teacher associations through outreach campaigns.
  • It focuses oncultural inclusion, health check-ups, awareness sessions, and recreational activitiesfor holistic child development.
  • Kerala hosts over35 lakh migrant workers, many living with families, making such inclusion critical for social welfare.
  • SCERT (State Council of Educational Research and Training) develops tailored curriculum and supports this initiative.

question: Indira Soura Giri Jala Vikasam scheme launched in May 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheIndira Soura Giri Jala Vikasamscheme was launched by theTelangana governmentin May 2025.
  • It providesfree solar-powered irrigation pumps (5 to 7.5 horsepower)to1 lakh tribal farmersholding land under the Forest Rights Act (RoFR).
  • The scheme aims to promotesustainable agriculture, increase horticultural productivity, and ensure self-relianceamong tribal farmers in power-deficient areas.
  • It covers irrigation development on about6 lakh acres of forest landover five years with a budget allocation of₹12,600 crore.
  • Implementation is on a100% subsidy (free)basis, enabling tribal farmers to cultivate without electricity or diesel dependency.
  • The scheme was launched by Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy from Macharam village, Nagarkurnool district on 19 May 2025.
  • The government plans phased distribution after identifying eligible tribal farmers through local records and gram sabhas.

question: AI Development Project launched in May 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheAI Development Projectwas launched by theHaryana governmentin May 2025 with a total investment of₹474.39 crore, supported by theWorld Bank.
  • The project aims to transform Haryana into anational hub for AI-enabled developmentover three years (2025–2028).
  • Key infrastructure includes theGlobal Artificial Intelligence Centre (GAIC) in Gurugramand theHaryana Advanced Computing Facility (HACF) in Panchkula.
  • It will train and transition over50,000 professionals in AI, machine learning, and data science.
  • The initiative focuses on integrating AI inpublic governance and data-driven service deliveryacross government departments.
  • It also promotesstart-ups, research & development, and entrepreneurshipwith incubation, mentoring, and shared computing infrastructure.
  • The funding pattern is70:30 between the World Bank and Haryana government.

question: eri koli duti paat yojna launched in May 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheEri Koli Duti Paat Yojnawas launched by theAssam governmentin May 2025.
  • It provides a₹5,000 one-time financial aidtotea garden workerson the occasion of Assam Tea's 200th anniversary.
  • This scheme honors the contribution of tea workers to Assam’s tea industry, which has a 200-year legacy dating back to 1823.
  • Assam produces over 50% of India’s total tea and employs over 7 lakh workers in the tea sector.
  • The celebration included international events promoting Assam Tea’s heritage and global significance, emphasizing support for tea laborers’ welfare.
  • The scheme aims to improve the financial well-being of tea garden workers, recognizing their vital role in the state's economy.

question: How much money is provided as financial assistance for Divyang scholars under the Chief Minister's Jiban Anuprerana Scheme launched by Assam government in June 2025?
solution:
• TheChief Minister's Jiban Anuprerana Schemewas launched by theAssam government in June 2025to support full-time research scholars.
  • It provides aone-time financial assistance of ₹25,000 for general research scholars.
  • Differently-abled (Divyang) research scholars receive a higher grant of ₹40,000.
  • The scheme aims to promoteinclusive academic growth and innovationby easing financial burdens faced by scholars.
  • Eligible scholars must be permanent residents of Assam and enrolled full-time in public institutions including state and central universities.
  • This initiative supports academic research activities like materials, travel, and data collection expenses, making research more accessible and inclusive.

question: Thalliki Vandanam scheme launched in June 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheThalliki Vandanam schemewas launched by theAndhra Pradesh governmentin June 2025.
  • It provides₹15,000 annual financial aidto mothers or guardians of school-going children from Classes 1 to 12 to ensure continued education.
  • The assistance is given throughDirect Benefit Transfer (DBT)directly into the mother's/guardian's bank account.
  • The scheme covers students studying inall recognized government, private aided and private unaided schools and junior colleges, including residential institutions across the state.
  • Approximately67 lakh students and 43 lakh mothers/guardiansare expected to benefit in the academic year 2025-26.
  • From the ₹15,000 aid,₹2,000 per child is deducted at sourceand allocated for overall development and maintenance of the educational ecosystem, such as hygiene and sanitation in schools.
  • The scheme aims to reduce dropout rates by financially empowering mothers to support their children's education.
  • Eligibility requires eKYC and linking of Aadhaar with bank accounts for smooth transfer.

question: vidya shakti scheme launched in june 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheVidya Shakti schemewas launched by theAndhra Pradesh governmentin June 2025.
  • It providestech-enabled remedial education in Mathematics, Science, and Englishfor academically weak students in government schools to reduce dropouts and improve learning outcomes.
  • The program covers students fromClass 6 to Class 12in government high schools and junior colleges, including residential and non-residential schools like Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas (KGBVs), AP Residential Educational Institutions (APREIS), and model schools.
  • Classes are held after regular school hours, typically from 4 PM to 5 PM via live online sessions using technology-supported methods.
  • The scheme includes additional sessions oncareer guidance, personality development, and yoga, along with regular assessments and progress tracking using a dedicated app.
  • The initiative is implemented in partnership withIIT Madras Pravartak Technology Innovation Huband has been scaled up to about5,000 schoolsacross the state.
  • It aims toimprove learning levels, boost confidence, and prevent academic dropoutamong underperforming students through personalized and technology-supported remedial teaching.

question: How much money is provided for self-employment projects under the Chief Minister's Single Women Self-Employment Scheme launched by Uttarakhand Government in June 2025?
solution:
• TheChief Minister's Single Women Self-Employment Schemewas launched by theUttarakhand government in June 2025.
  • It provides financial support for self-employment projects up to₹2 lakhfor single women including unmarried, divorced, abandoned, or disabled.
  • The government offers a75% subsidy (grant)on the project cost, meaning beneficiaries need to invest only 25% of the amount themselves.
  • Thus, for a ₹2 lakh project, the government subsidy can be up to₹1.5 lakh.
  • The scheme aims to empower single women economically by enabling them to start various businesses like agriculture, poultry, beauty parlors, data entry, and more.
  • Eligibility includes women aged between 21-50, with an annual income not exceeding ₹72,000, residing in Uttarakhand.
  • The scheme is implemented by the Women Empowerment and Child Development Department and targets at least 2,000 beneficiaries initially.

question: Rajiv Gandhi Van Samvardhan Yojana launched in June 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheRajiv Gandhi Van Samvardhan Yojanawas launched by theHimachal Pradesh governmentin June 2025.
  • The scheme aims toboost green cover by planting fruit-bearing trees on degraded forest land.
  • It emphasizesgenerating rural employment and incomethrough the active involvement ofMahila Mandals, Yuvak Mandals, and Self-Help Groups (SHGs).
  • The local communities are responsible for plantation andmaintenance of trees for five yearsto ensure survival and ecological restoration.
  • The scheme promotesenvironmental conservation combined with community empowerment, especially for women and youth.
  • Corporate participation is also encouraged under a Green Adoption Scheme alongside this initiative.

question: Kusum-C Project launched in June 2025 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheKusum-C Projectwas launched by theKarnataka government in June 2025.
  • It aims tosolarise agricultural feeders and provide reliable daytime electricity to farmers’ pump sets, promoting clean energy use and reducing dependence on conventional electricity.
  • The project targets solar power generation of2,400 MW across the stateto support farmers' irrigation needs.
  • It is part of the central government’s flagshipPM-KUSUM schemeencouraging solarisation of existing grid-connected agricultural pumps.
  • The state government provides a50% subsidy, while the central government gives 30% subsidyfor the installation cost; the remaining is borne by farmers.
  • The initiative helps farmers generate solar power on their land, reduce electricity bills, and potentially sell excess power to the grid.
  • Karnataka inaugurated its first large Kusum-C solar plant (20 MW) in Gauribidanur, Chikkaballapur district.
  • The scheme also helps ease the load on the state power grid and promotes sustainable agriculture.

question: Mangla Pashu Beema Yojana was launched by which state government to protect farmers and livestock owners against financial loss caused by death of their animals due to accidents, natural calamities, or diseases?
solution:
• TheMangla Pashu Beema Yojanawas launched by theRajasthan governmentin 2024-25 to provide financial security to livestock owners.
  • It aims to protect farmers and livestock owners against financial loss caused by the death of their animals due to accidents, natural calamities, or diseases.
  • The scheme covers up to5 lakh cows/buffaloes,5 lakh sheep/goats, and1 lakh camels, targeting a total of around21 lakh animals.
  • Eligible animals must be tagged (with RFID), milk-producing, or load-bearing.
  • Beneficiaries are livestock owners having Jan Aadhaar, Gopal Credit Cards, or Lakhpati Didi Cards.
  • Registration is free and done online, with alottery-based selection processprioritizing SC/ST and cardholders.
  • A total budget of₹400 crorehas been allocated for this scheme.
  • Each eligible livestock owner can insure a limited number of animals free of cost (max 2 dairy animals, or 10 sheep/goats, or 1 camel).
  • The scheme ensures compensation and economic security by providing insurance cover for one year.

question: NAMO Drone Didi Scheme launched on 30 November 2024 was started by which government department?
option_1: Ministry of Women and Child Development
option_2: Department of Rural Development
option_3: Department of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare
option_4: Ministry of Skill Development
solution:
• TheNAMO Drone Didi Schemewas launched on30 November 2024by theDepartment of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare (DoA&FW).
  • It aims toempower rural womenby providing agricultural drones and training women-led Self-Help Groups (SHGs) to become drone pilots.
  • About15,000 Women SHGsunder the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Rural Livelihood Mission (DAY-NRLM) are targeted to receive drones for agricultural services like applying liquid fertilisers and pesticides.
  • The scheme covers80% subsidy on drone costs up to ₹8 lakh, with easy loan facilities for the remaining cost.
  • The initiative includesdrone pilot trainingand enables SHGs to provide drone rental services to farmers, generating additional income and promoting sustainable agriculture.
  • Implementation is supported by Krishi Vigyan Kendras (KVKs) and involves multiple ministries such as Agriculture, Rural Development, Civil Aviation, Fertilizers, and Women & Child Development.
  • This scheme also contributes to reducing farmers' input costs and increasing crop productivity through modern technology adoption.

question: Ayushman Vay Vandana Yojana launchedin October 2024 wasstarted by whichstate government?
solution:
• TheAyushman Vay Vandana Yojanawaslaunched by theMaharashtra governmentinOctober2024.
  • Itprovidessenior citizensaged 70 yearsand above withfree medicaltreatment upto ₹5 lakh annuallyat AB PM-JAY empanelled hospitals.
  • The schemeensuresaccessible anddignified healthcarefor elderlypeople regardlessof their socio-economic status.
  • It is partof an expansionof the Ayushman BharatPradhan Mantri JanArogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) focusedexclusively onthe senior population.
  • Over 25 lakhsenior citizensenrolled withinmonths of thelaunch, accessingtreatments forconditions likeangioplasty, cataract surgery, dialysis, hip replacement, and more.
  • Benefitsincludecashless treatmentin thousandsof hospitalsnationwideandcoverage of approximately2,000 medicalprocedures.
  • Thescheme promotesthehealth andfinancial securityof senior citizens, enabling themto receive timelycare withoutout-of-pocket expenses.

question: Zero Poverty Scheme launched in October 2024 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheZero Poverty Schemewas launched by theUttar Pradesh governmenton2 October 2024, coinciding withGandhi Jayanti.
  • The scheme aims to uplift25 lakh ultra-poor familiesby increasing their annual income to₹1.25 lakhthrough targeted welfare schemes andDirect Benefit Transfers (DBT).
  • It targets the poorest families, identified at thegram panchayat level(10 to 25 families per village), based on conditions likehomelessness, landlessness, irregular income, and lack of basic resources.
  • The program integrates multiple state and central government welfare schemes such asPradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, Mukhyamantri Awas Yojana, PM-Kisan, Ayushman Bharat, and others to ensureholistic supportincluding housing, healthcare, pensions, and ration benefits.
  • The government aims to makeUttar Pradesh India’s first zero-poverty state by 2 October 2025, implementing the campaign in phases with strongadministrative monitoring.
  • A budget of₹250 crorewas allocated in February 2025 for ensuringfood, clothing, education, medicine, housing, and sustainable income supportsfor beneficiary families.
  • Corporate social responsibility funds and partnerships with local bodies are also leveraged foreffective implementation.

question: PM Internship Scheme (PMIS) launched on 3 October 2024 aims to provide internship opportunities to how many youth in top companies over five years?
solution:
• ThePrime Minister Internship Scheme (PMIS)was announced in theUnion Budget 2024-25and launched on3 October 2024by theMinistry of Corporate Affairs, Government of India.
  • The scheme aims to provideinternship opportunities to one crore youthacross India over the nextfive yearsin thetop 500 companies.
  • It offers a12-month internship exposureto real-life business environments to improve youth employability by bridging the gap between academics and industry needs.
  • Interns receive amonthly stipend of ₹4,500 from the Government plus ₹500 from the respective company, totaling ₹5,000 per month.
  • Additionally, there is aone-time grant of ₹6,000for incidental expenses.
  • The scheme targets youth aged21 to 24 yearswho are not enrolled in full-time education or full-time employment.
  • Interns getinsurance coverageunder Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana and Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana during the internship.
  • The pilot phase planned to provide25 lakh internship opportunitiesin the financial year 2024-25, expanding nationwide over subsequent years.
  • This initiative aims to make India a globalSkill Capitalby enhancing youth employability through quality industrial exposure and training.

question: Which category of women is eligible for the Subhadra Scheme launched by the Odisha government in September 2024?
option_1: Women aged 21–60 from economically weaker sections
option_2: Only married women aged 21–40
option_3: Women from all income groups aged 18–60
solution:
• TheSubhadra Schemelaunched by theOdisha government in September 2024provides₹10,000 annual financial assistance in two installmentsto women aged21 to 60 years.
  • It targetswomen from economically weaker sections, specifically those covered under theNational Food Security Act (NFSA)orState Food Security Scheme (SFSS), or those with a family income below ₹2.5 lakh annually.
  • The scheme excludes women with a family income over ₹2.5 lakh who are not under NFSA/SFSS, government regular or contractual employees, pensioners, elected MPs/MLAs, income tax payers, and owners of large land or vehicles as per specific limits.
  • Beneficiaries must be residents of Odisha with Aadhaar linked to an active DBT-enabled bank account, complete e-KYC, and fulfill other official norms for eligibility.
  • The assistance is disbursed in two ₹5,000 installments on Raksha Bandhan and International Women’s Day, promoting financial independence and digital inclusion for eligible women.

question: HIM-UNNATI yojana launched on 9 August 2024 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheHIM-UNNATI Yojanawas launched by theHimachal Pradesh governmenton9 August 2024.
  • It promotesnatural farmingand makes agricultureeconomically viablethrough acluster-based development model.
  • Supports about92 lakh farmerspracticing chemical-free farming onover 32,149 hectares.
  • Creates2,600 focused agricultural clustersfor bulk production and better market surplus.
  • Benefitssmall & marginal farmers, women, SC/ST, and BPL families.
  • Expected to createself-employment opportunities for around 50,000 farmers.
  • Budget allocated:₹150 crore, with provisions for Farmer Producer Organisations (FPOs) and fencing support.
  • The state willprocure naturally grown grains at fixed ratesto encourage chemical-free farming.

question: Shramik Basera scheme launched in July 2024 was started by which state government and how much rent is charged per day for temporary housing?
solution:
• TheShramik Basera schemewas launched by theGujarat government in July 2024.
  • It providestemporary housing to registered construction workers and their families near work sites.
  • Rent for accommodation is charged at a nominal rate of₹5 per day per person.
  • Children up to the age of 6 can stayrent-free.
  • The accommodation includesbasic amenities like electricity, drinking water, security, medical, and childcare facilities provided free of costby the government.
  • The scheme aims toimprove living standards of construction workersby offering affordable, safe, and convenient shelter close to their workplaces.
  • Initially, facilities are set up at multiple sites in Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Rajkot, and Vadodara benefiting around 15,000 workers in the first phase.
  • The project targets providing housing for up to 3 lakh construction workers across Gujarat in the next three years with a budget of ₹1,500 crore.

question: Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana launchedin July 2024 wasstarted by whichstate government?
solution:
• TheMajhi Ladki Bahin Yojanawaslaunched by theMaharashtra governmentin July 2024.
  • Thescheme providesRs 1,500 permonththroughdirect benefittransfer to eligiblewomen aged21 to 65 years.
  • It aimsto improveeconomic independence, health, andnutritionofwomen, and strengthentheir role inthe family.
  • Eligiblewomen includemarried, widowed, divorced, abandoned, destitute, and oneunmarried womanper family.
  • Thescheme targetsabout5 crorewomenin Maharashtrawith a budgetallocation ofaround₹4,787 crore.
  • Benefitsare directlydeposited intoAadhaar linkedbank accountsof beneficiaries.
  • The governmenthas extendedthe last dateof applicationdue to overwhelmingresponse andperiodicallyreleases installmentscovering multiplemonths.
  • Thescheme is implementedby the Womenand Child DevelopmentDepartment.

question: One Scientist One Product Programme launched on 16 July 2024 was started by which organization?
option_1: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)
option_2: National Institute of Agricultural Extension Management (MANAGE)
option_3: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)
option_4: Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR)
solution:
• The One Scientist One Product Programme was launched on 16 July 2024 by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).
  • The scheme aims to enhance agricultural productivity by assigning specific research targets (products, technologies, models, or publications) to individual scientists over the next 5 years.
  • It involves all 5,521 ICAR scientists who identify their project annually, with progress monitored quarterly and biannually.
  • The programme focuses initially on high-yielding oilseeds and pulses, aiming for accelerated innovation and avoiding duplication of research efforts.
  • ICAR also announced the release of 323 new crop varieties across 56 crops, including 289 climate-resilient and 27 bio-fortified varieties.
  • The initiative aligns with a broader 100-day action plan targeting the development of 100 new seed varieties and 100 farm technologies rapidly.
  • This programme is expected to boost research efficiency, specialization, and productivity in agriculture and animal husbandry.

question: SWAYAM Scheme launched by the Government of Odisha aims to promote entrepreneurship among which group?
solution:
• TheSWAYAM (Swatantra Yuva Udyami) Schemewas launched by theGovernment of Odisha on 12 February 2024.
  • The scheme aims topromote entrepreneurship among unemployed or underemployed youth aged 18 to 35 years(up to 40 years for SC/ST/PwD).
  • It providesinterest-free loans of up to ₹1 lakh(₹95,000 loan + ₹5,000 margin money) to encourage youths to start or expand micro-enterprises in services, manufacturing, and petty trade.
  • The loan iscollateral-free and comes with no processing charges, and repayment tenure is generally 4 years with a moratorium of 3-6 months.
  • The scheme targetseconomic empowerment, job creation, and financial self-reliance in Odisha's youth.
  • Beneficiaries must be residents of Odisha and meet specified eligibility conditions such as family income limits and exclusion of government employees.
  • The state government fully subsidizes the interest component, making the loan effectively interest-free for beneficiaries.

question: PM Surya Ghar Free Electricity scheme provides how many units of free electricity to every family?
solution:
• ThePM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojanawas launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on15 February 2024.
  • This scheme provides300 units of free electricity every monthto eligible households through the installation of rooftop solar panels.
  • It aims to promote renewable energy use, reduce electricity bills for poor and middle-income families, and decrease reliance on conventional power.
  • The government offers a subsidy covering up to40% of the solar panel installation cost, making the technology affordable.
  • About1 crore householdsare expected to benefit from this scheme nationwide.
  • The scheme also encourages employment by training solar technicians to support installation and maintenance.
  • Beneficiaries must have a legal house with suitable rooftop space and a valid electricity connection, and they should not have availed other solar subsidies.

question: CM Vayoshri Yojana likely to benefit how many senior citizens suffering from physical or mental disability?
solution:
• TheCM Vayoshri Yojanawas launched by theMaharashtra governmenton5 February 2024.
  • It targets approximately15 lakh senior citizens aged 65 and abovewho have somephysical or mental disability.
  • Eligible beneficiaries receive aone-time financial aid of ₹3,000, directly deposited into their bank accounts.
  • The scheme helps seniors purchasemedical aids and devicessuch as glasses, walkers, wheelchairs, hearing aids, and other supportive equipment.
  • Eligibility criteria include being a resident of Maharashtra, age 65 or older, having a family income below ₹2 lakh per year, and possessing Aadhaar linked bank accounts.
  • The government allocated a budget of around₹480 crores annuallyfor this scheme.
  • Health departments conduct screenings to identify eligible beneficiaries, promoting their independence and improved quality of life.

question: LABHA scheme launched in January 2024 was started by which state government?
solution:
• TheLABHA (Laghu Bana Jatya Drabya Kraya) schemewas launched by theOdisha government in January 2024.
  • It is a100% state-funded Minimum Support Price (MSP) scheme for Minor Forest Produce (MFP)collected by tribal communities.
  • The scheme aims toempower over 1 crore tribal peopleby ensuringfair pricingfor their MFP through fixed MSP decided annually by the state.
  • Tribal primary collectors, especially women who form 99% of collectors, can sell MFP at procurement centers managed by theTribal Development Cooperative Corporation of Odisha Limited (TDCCOL).
  • Payments are made viaDirect Benefit Transfer (DBT)into beneficiaries’ bank accounts, eliminating middlemen anddistress sales.
  • The scheme integrates withMission Shakti’s women Self-Help Groups (SHGs)to enhance participation and management.
  • An initial fund allocation of around₹100 crorewas made, with SHGs or agencies receiving a2% commission.
  • The government also plans value addition and processing units, including a₹25 crore tamarind processing plant in Rayagadato increase returns for tribal producers.
  • LABHA covers 119 tribal blocks in 14 tribal districts, focusing on sustainable livelihoods and tribal development.

question: Rani Durgawati Shri Anna Protsahan Yojana launched in January 2024 was started by which government?
solution:
• TheRani Durgawati Shri Anna Protsahan Yojanawas launched by theGovernment of Madhya Pradesh in January 2024.
  • It is aDirect Benefit Transfer (DBT) scheme, where the incentive amount for the crop is directly transferred to the bank account of the beneficiary farmer.
  • The scheme focuses on encouraging cultivation ofcoarse grains (millets)such asbajra, kodo, kutki, and ragiby providing an incentive of₹10 per kilogramof produce.
  • It mainly benefits farmers belonging tobackward and tribal communitiesgrowing these coarse grains.
  • The government also approved additional assistance of up to₹3,900 per hectarefor millet farmers under this scheme.
  • The scheme aims to enhance farmer income, promote millet cultivation, and empower tribal and backward farmers financially.

question: PM PRANAM Yojana launched in the Union Budget 2023-24 was started by which entity?
option_2: Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers
option_3: Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
option_4: Ministry of Rural Development
solution:
• ThePM PRANAM (Programme for Restoration, Awareness, Nourishment, and Amelioration of Mother Earth)was launched in theUnion Budget 2023-24by theMinistry of Chemicals and Fertilizers.
  • The scheme aims toreduce the use of chemical fertilizersby incentivizing states and union territories to adoptalternative fertilizerssuch as biofertilizers and organic fertilizers, promotingsustainable and balanced fertilizer use.
  • It is designed tolower the subsidy burden on chemical fertilizers, which was around ₹2.25 lakh crore in 2022-23.
  • Under the scheme, states that reduce consumption of chemical fertilizers compared to previous years receive50% of the subsidy savings as grants, which they can use for promoting alternative fertilizers and related development activities.
  • The programme is operational from the financial year 2023-24 to 2025-26.
  • The scheme also complements efforts for organic and natural farming, soil health restoration, and environmental protection.
  • It is financed through savings from existing fertilizer subsidies under schemes run by the Department of Fertilizers.

question: PM MUDRA Yojana launched to support micro and small enterprises provides loan up to how much amount after the 2024-25 budget increase?
solution:
• ThePradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY)is a government scheme launched on8 April 2015to provide loans to micro, non-corporate, and small enterprises in manufacturing, trading, services, and allied agricultural activities.
  • Initially, the scheme offered loans up to₹10 lakh, but following theUnion Budget 2024-25 (announced on 23 July 2024), the loan limit was increased to₹20 lakheffective from24 October 2024.
  • A new loan category calledTarun Pluswas introduced for entrepreneurs who have successfully repaid earlier loans under the Tarun category. It allows loans between₹10 lakh and ₹20 lakh.
  • Loans under PMMY arecollateral-freeand extended by Member Lending Institutions like Scheduled Commercial Banks, Regional Rural Banks, Small Finance Banks, NBFCs, and MFIs.
  • The Credit Guarantee Fund for Micro Units (CGFMU) provides guarantee coverage for loans up to ₹20 lakh, encouraging lending to micro enterprises.
  • The scheme supports diverse income-generating activities inmanufacturing, trading, services, food processing, and agriculture allied sectorssuch as poultry, dairy, beekeeping, and others.

question: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) was launched with the primary objective to provide which of the following?
option_1: Free health insurance to all citizens
option_2: Universal access to banking services for every unbanked adult
option_3: Employment to rural youth
option_4: Interest-free loans to farmers only
solution:
• ThePradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY)was launched in August 2014 as aNational Mission for Financial Inclusion.
  • It aims to provideuniversal access to banking services for every unbanked adultand ensure financial inclusion across India.
  • Under the scheme, beneficiaries get aBasic Savings Bank Deposit Account (BSBDA)withno minimum balance requirement.
  • Accounts come with aRuPay debit cardthat includes anaccidental insurance cover up to ₹2 lakhs.
  • There is anoverdraft facility of up to ₹10,000available to account holders after account operation for six months.
  • The scheme has successfully opened over55 crore accountscovering rural and urban populations.
  • It includes services likecredit access, remittances, insurance, and pension, targeting weaker sections and low-income groups.
  • Applications require basic documents like Aadhaar, government ID, and address proof.

question: PM SvaNIDHI scheme was launched by which government ministry and what does it aim to provide to street vendors?
option_1: Ministry of Agriculture, crop insurance
option_2: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, collateral-free working capital loans
option_3: Ministry of Finance, income tax benefits
option_4: Ministry of Rural Development, rural employment
solution:
• ThePM SVANidhi (Prime Minister Street Vendor's AtmaNirbhar Nidhi) schemeis launched by theMinistry of Housing and Urban Affairs.
  • It providescollateral-free working capital loans up to ₹10,000to street vendors to help them restart, sustain, and expand their businesses.
  • The loan tenure is generally one year, with options for higher loan amounts (₹20,000 and ₹50,000) after timely repayment of the first loan.
  • Aninterest subsidy of 7% per annumis credited to vendors who repay loans promptly.
  • To promote digital transactions, the scheme offersmonthly cashback incentives up to ₹100.
  • The scheme aims toformalize street vending businesses, promote financial inclusion, economic upliftment, and increase vendors' creditworthiness.
  • Eligibility includes street vendors operating before 24 March 2020 with valid vending certificates or recommendations from Urban Local Bodies.

question: PM-YASASVI scheme primarily aims to provide scholarships to which group of students?
solution:
• ThePM-YASASVI (Prime Minister Young Achievers Scholarship Award Scheme for Vibrant India)is launched by theMinistry of Social Justice and Empowerment.
  • It targetsstudents from OBC, EBC, and Denotified, Nomadic & Semi-Nomadic Tribes (DNT)communities to promote educational empowerment.
  • Providesscholarships for pre-matric (Class 9-10) and post-matric (higher secondary and beyond)studies.
  • Family income of applicants must bebelow ₹2.5 lakh per annum.
  • The scheme integrates earlier scholarship programs into a single umbrella scheme for better impact.
  • Selection may involve merit-based entrance tests such as YASASVI Entrance Test (YET) conducted by the National Testing Agency.
  • Benefits includetuition fees, hostel fees, academic allowances, and full financial support for top-class educationfrom Class 9 to college level.
  • The scheme emphasizes monitoring attendance (minimum 75%) and performance via Aadhaar-based attendance systems.
  • 30% of funds are allocated for girls and 5% for students with disabilities.
  • It promotes socio-economic development by reducing financial barriers to quality education.

question: PM Vishwakarma Scheme is launched to provide holistic support to which group of people?
option_2: Traditional artisans and craftspeople
solution:
• The PM Vishwakarma Scheme aims to provide holistic support to traditional artisans and craftspeople across both rural and urban areas.
  • It focuses on phased saturation of districts from FY 2023-24 to FY 2027-28.
  • The scheme enables recognition of artisans and craftspeople as Vishwakarmas and provides skill upgradation opportunities.
  • It offers a platform for brand promotion and market linkages to help participants access new growth opportunities.
  • The objective is to enhance the socio-economic status of artisans through recognition, skill development, and improved market access.

question: How much money per year is given to eligible farmers under the PM KISAN scheme?
solution:
• ThePM KISAN schemeprovides₹6,000 per yearto eligible small and marginal farmers.
  • The amount is disbursed inthree equal installments of ₹2,000 eachevery four months.
  • This direct cash transfer helps farmers meet agricultural and household expenses such as seeds, fertilizers, and other inputs.
  • The scheme covers all landholding farmer families, including those from SC, ST, and other categories.
  • Payments are made viaDirect Benefit Transfer (DBT)directly into beneficiaries’ bank accounts.
  • The scheme aims to improve farmers’ financial well-being and promote agricultural growth.

question: PM GatiShakti scheme was launched with the objective to support which of the following?
option_1: Providing direct cash benefits to farmers
option_2: Ensuring seamless multimodal connectivity and infrastructure coordination
option_3: Offering scholarships to economically backward students
option_4: Promoting small scale industries
solution:
• PM GatiShakti National Master Plan was launched to provideseamless multimodal connectivity infrastructureacross various economic zones of India.
  • It integrates 16 ministries and schemes like Railways, Roads, Ports, Waterways, Airports, Mass Transport, and Logistics to promote coordinated planning and execution.
  • The scheme uses adigital GIS-based platformto offer comprehensive data and monitoring, facilitating faster project completion and cost efficiency.
  • The objective is to improveease of living, ease of doing business, and boost economic growth by reducing delays and optimizing infrastructure use.
  • It supportsenergy transmission, IT communication, bulk water & sewerage, and social infrastructurefor holistic development.
  • PM GatiShakti aims to make India globally competitive by enhancing infrastructure, creating jobs, and fostering entrepreneurial opportunities.
  • It covers various infrastructure projects under programs such as Bharatmala, Sagarmala, UDAN, and Industrial corridors, enabling integrated connectivity nationwide.
